findings.title: DAS-4:Contract address hardcoded
findings.description: Hardcoded addresses directly in the contract's logic makes the contract less adaptable to changes and more prone to human errors, especially if these addresses need to be updated or are different across various networks (mainnet, testnet, etc.).

findings.title: DOS: DAS-3:Adding liquidity to pools without gauge may be impossible
findings.description: The `get_gauge()` function returns address(0) if gauge doesn't exist. When liquidity is added to the pool, the `execute()` function tries to deposit lp tokens, leading to a transaction revert. Users will be unable to add liquidity to some pools.
